column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=IV
#Text=The next morning Angelique , Amedee 's wife , was in the kitchen baking pies , assisted by old Mrs. Chevalier .
#Text=Between the mixing-board and the stove stood the old cradle that had been Amedee 's , and in it was his black-eyed son .
#Text=As Angelique , flushed and excited , with flour on her hands , stopped to smile at the baby , Emil Bergson rode up to the kitchen door on his mare and dismounted .
#Text=“ '
#Text=Medee is out in the field , Emil , ” Angelique called as she ran across the kitchen to the oven . “ He begins to cut his wheat to-day ; the first wheat ready to cut anywhere about here .
#Text=He bought a new header , you know , because all the wheat 's so short this year .
#Text=I hope he can rent it to the neighbors , it cost so much .
#Text=He and his cousins bought a steam thresher on shares .
#Text=You ought to go out and see that header work .
#Text=I watched it an hour this morning , busy as I am with all the men to feed .
#Text=He has a lot of hands , but he 's the only one that knows how to drive the header or how to run the engine , so he has to be everywhere at once .
#Text=He 's sick , too , and ought to be in his bed . ”
#Text=Emil bent over Hector Baptiste , trying to make him blink his round , bead-like black eyes .
#Text=“ Sick ?
#Text=What 's the matter with your daddy , kid ?
#Text=Been making him walk the floor with you ? ”
#Text=Angelique sniffed .
#Text=“ Not much ! We do n't have that kind of babies .
#Text=It was his father that kept Baptiste awake .
#Text=All night I had to be getting up and making mustard plasters to put on his stomach .
#Text=He had an awful colic .
#Text=He said he felt better this morning , but I do n't think he ought to be out in the field , overheating himself . ”
#Text=Angelique did not speak with much anxiety , not because she was indifferent , but because she felt so secure in their good fortune .
#Text=Only good things could happen to a rich , energetic , handsome young man like Amedee , with a new baby in the cradle and a new header in the field .
#Text=Emil stroked the black fuzz on Baptiste 's head .
#Text=“ I say , Angelique , one of '
#Text=Medee 's grandmothers , ' way back , must have been a squaw .
#Text=This kid looks exactly like the Indian babies . ”
#Text=Angelique made a face at him , but old Mrs. Chevalier had been touched on a sore point , and she let out such a stream of fiery PATOIS that Emil fled from the kitchen and mounted his mare .
#Text=Opening the pasture gate from the saddle , Emil rode across the field to the clearing where the thresher stood , driven by a stationary engine and fed from the header boxes .

#Text=As Amedee was not on the engine , Emil rode on to the wheatfield , where he recognized , on the header , the slight , wiry figure of his friend , coatless , his white shirt puffed out by the wind , his straw hat stuck jauntily on the side of his head .

#Text=The six big work-horses that drew , or rather pushed , the header , went abreast at a rapid walk , and as they were still green at the work they required a good deal of management on Amedee 's part ; especially when they turned the corners , where they divided , three and three , and then swung round into line again with a movement that looked as complicated as a wheel of artillery .

#Text=Emil felt a new thrill of admiration for his friend , and with it the old pang of envy at the way in which Amedee could do with his might what his hand found to do , and feel that , whatever it was , it was the most important thing in the world .
#Text=“ I 'll have to bring Alexandra up to see this thing work , ” Emil thought ; “ it 's splendid ! ”
#Text=When he saw Emil , Amedee waved to him and called to one of his twenty cousins to take the reins .
#Text=Stepping off the header without stopping it , he ran up to Emil who had dismounted .
#Text=“ Come along , ” he called .
#Text=“ I have to go over to the engine for a minute .
#Text=I gotta green man running it , and I gotta to keep an eye on him . ”
#Text=Emil thought the lad was unnaturally flushed and more excited than even the cares of managing a big farm at a critical time warranted .
#Text=As they passed behind a last year 's stack , Amedee clutched at his right side and sank down for a moment on the straw .
#Text=“ Ouch !
#Text=I got an awful pain in me , Emil .
#Text=Something 's the matter with my insides , for sure . ”
#Text=Emil felt his fiery cheek .
#Text=“ You ought to go straight to bed , ' Medee , and telephone for the doctor ; that 's what you ought to do . ”
#Text=Amedee staggered up with a gesture of despair .
#Text=“ How can I ?
#Text=I got no time to be sick .
#Text=Three thousand dollars ' worth of new machinery to manage , and the wheat so ripe it will begin to shatter next week .
#Text=My wheat 's short , but it 's gotta grand full berries .
#Text=What 's he slowing down for ?
#Text=We have n't got header boxes enough to feed the thresher , I guess . ”
#Text=Amedee started hot-foot across the stubble , leaning a little to the right as he ran , and waved to the engineer not to stop the engine .
#Text=Emil saw that this was no time to talk about his own affairs .
#Text=He mounted his mare and rode on to Sainte-Agnes , to bid his friends there good-bye .
#Text=He went first to see Raoul Marcel , and found him innocently practising the “ Gloria ” for the big confirmation service on Sunday while he polished the mirrors of his father 's saloon .
